Hi PDE Team

I am trying to debug a plugin within the same Eclipse workbench for testing 
purpose and it seems that the configration file makes the pdelauch looping 
somewhere. Here is the lof of the runtime-workspace...In the log of the 
workspace, nothing is logged!!

Context:
Eclipse Platform

Version: 2.1.2
Build id: 200311030802

Regards

It seems to me that your prerequisites are incorrect. You either introduced a 
cycle in your dependencies or miss a plugin.
Check your target platform and the prereqs of your plugin.

Hi Pascal

I have made additional tests. First of all, I remove from the Runtime 
workbench, all fragments and then the pdelaunch was working. After all, I 
finally find out what was the pertinent fragment that was producing this error.
I have 3 fragments and only one does not reference the org.eclipse.swt plugin 
and when I add any of the 2 others, the pdelaunch is looping. So, IMO, the 
problem could be reproduced anytime you add a fragment that references the 
org.eclipse.plugin as mine:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<fragment
   id="com.pac.iwc.swt"
   name="com.pac.iwc.swt"
   version="1.0.0"
   plugin-id="org.eclipse.swt"
   plugin-version="2.1.2">

   <runtime>
      <library name="swt.jar">
         <export name="*"/>
         <packages prefixes="org.eclipse.swt.custom"/>
      </library>
   </runtime>

   <requires>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.swt" export="true"/>
   </requires>


</fragment>


Regards

FA

Steps to reproduce:
- create a fragment for plug-in A
- also put plug-in A in the <requires> clause in the fragment.xml

Work around: don't include the plug-in in the requires clause.

Marking as invalid.

You shouldn't put the plug-in in the requires clause. A fragment is basically an
addition to the hosting plug-in.

Presumably you would get the same error if you created a plug-in A and required
yourself in your plugin.xml.
